item.title: The Buddhist UN Boss Who Excelled at Mediation
item.description: Although U Thant, a Burmese national, often made front-page headlines in major newspapers when he was United Nations secretary-general, from 1961 to 1971, his name is virtually forgotten today. But his grandson Thant Myint-U’s new book, “Peacemaker: U Thant and the Forgotten Quest for a Just World,” reveals rich layers of history during the 1960s, ... Read more
